boat.name: George and Alice
boat.full_description:
Built for George Stoker of Mersea in 1896, by Aldous & Sons, the Essex oyster smack was named for George and his wife Alice. From 1896 to 1939 she was a commercial oyster dredger, stowboating and inshore trawling under sail from Brightlinsea. She was rebuilt in 1953 and recorded as still fishing until 1967. She had another major refit in 2002.

After the second world war she was sold to Malcolm Macgregor and then in 1991 to Colin Shepheard who took her to his workshop in South Devon and fully restored her to her original build. In 1996 she returned to her home port of Brightlingsea and was bought by the Winters family, remaining the only fully rebuilt Brightlingsea fishing smack.
boat.construction_details: Carvel with larch planking with square cut galvanised nails on grown oak frames. Spars are Douglas fir.
boat.short_description: 'George and Alice' was a commercial fishing boat, no. CK76, working out of Brightlingsea oyster dredging, stowboating and inshore trawling.
